chapters.title: Glacier National Park Glaciers
chapters.description: The Thwaites Glacier flows into the arm of the Amundsen Sea in West Antarctica. Only a few people ever set foot on this glacier due to it's remote location, 1600 km away from the British research station.

chapters.title: Harrison Glacier, 1998
chapters.description: Harrison Glacier is located in the US state of Montana in Glacier National Park. Situated on a southeast facing ridge immediately south of Mount Jackson, Harrison Glacier is the largest glacier in Glacier National Park. Compared to many of the vanishing glaciers in Glacier National Park, Harrison Glacier has a much higher altitude accumulation zone (approximately 9,000 feet (2,700 m)) which has allowed it to maintain some equilibrium in its glacier mass balance.

chapters.title: Harrison Glacier, 2015
chapters.description: Between 1998 and 2015, Harrison Glacier lost 169 acres of surface area (about 37%).
